title-group.article-title: On the Stability and Convergence of Higher-Order Mixed Finite Element Methods for Second-Order Elliptic Problems

abstract.p: We investigate the use of higher-order mixed methods for second-order elliptic problems by establishing refined stability and convergence estimates which take into account both the mesh size $h$ and polynomial degree $p$. Our estimates yield asymptotic convergence rates for the $p$- and $h - p$-versions of the finite element method. They also describe more accurately than previously proved estimates the increased rate of convergence expected when the $h$-version is used with higher-order polynomials. For our analysis, we choose the Raviart-Thomas and the Brezzi-Douglas-Marini elements and establish optimal rates of convergence in both $h$ and $p$ (up to arbitrary $\varepsilon > 0$).
